topic.title: Editing Domain Properties
topic.p: You can edit domain properties using this feature.

ol.title: To edit a Domain's properties:

li.p: In the Domain Management menu group, click Domain List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.

ol.li: From the Display Domains of drop-down list, select the domain administrator of the domain you want to edit and click Go. The domain List window for that domain administrator appears.
In the Actions column, click properties for the domain you want to edit. The Properties window for the selected domain appears.
Next to Domain Setup, click Edit. The Edit Domain Setup window for the selected domain appears.
Next to Domain, you can disable or enable this domain's alias.
Next to IP Address, select the IP address for the domain.

Next to Web Services, select the web services you want to enable. Enabling CGI permits CGI scripts in the domain's cgi-bin directory. Enabling SSL permits secure HTTPS connection using a shared certificate.
Next to End Users, select the number of end users you want to allow the Domain administrator to create. Select An unlimited number of end users if you do not want to limit the number of end users.

Next to Email Addresses, select the number of email addresses you want to allow the Domain administrator to create. Select An unlimited number of email addresses if you do not want to limit the number of email addresses.

Select the Website log options you want:
Select Do not create or store website logs if you do not want the site to use logs.
Select Create and store website logs if you want to use third-party stats packages.
Select Never rotate website logs if you do not want to delete any logs.
Click Rotate and select the frequency of the log rotation you want from the associated drop-down menu.
Select the number of logs you want to save from the and save drop-down menu.
Next to Domain Contact, type the email address of the person to be contacted if error messages are generated for the domain.

Next to Mail Catchall, select the option you want:
Select Reject mail - return as unknown user if you want misaddressed mail returned to the user with an “unknown user”
reply message.
Select Silently discard mail if you want misaddressed mail deleted without a reply message sent to the sender.
Select Deliver mail to Domain Admin if you want misaddressed mail sent to the email address of the domain
administrator.
Select Deliver mail to: if you want misaddressed mail delivered to the email address you type in the associated field.
If you type multiple addresses, separate each one with a comma.
Note: If you type multiple addresses, separate each one with a comma.
Click Save. A message appears informing you that the domain has been saved.
